titleStmt.title: Variants of the bound pronoun 3rd person singular feminine after vowel
titleStmt.author: Veronika Engler

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the 3rd person singular feminine bound pronoun after vowel.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found

wib:featureValueObservation.note: -ya appears always after -ī, but in this position it is in variation with -ha
-wa appears always after -ū, but in this position it is in variation with -ha
-ū of the root becomes -w, after long ī the suffix becomes -h
-ū of the root becomes -w, when there is a word ending with long ī, ī is kept, and y+eh are added, ex karāsī-y-eh "her chairs"
-ū of the root becomes -w and ī becomes -y
after -ā only-h is added, -ū of the root becomes -w, when there is a word ending with long ī, ī is kept, and y+eh are added, ex karāsī-y-eh "her chairs"
suffix is -he after anterior vowel and non-emphatic consonants
-ū of the root becomes -w and ī becomes -y before the suffix -ah
this suffix -ha has been integrated and it appears together the form -ah already documented by Palva (1980)
Initial h may be regressively assimilated to preceding vowel, e.g. rikbitti(h) 'her knee'.
Final -a may be raised to become -i(h).
Initial h may be regressively assimilated to preceding vowel, e.g. ma ramēttāš 'I did not throw it (f.sg.)'.
-hi(ʔ) in pause and in neutral environments.
-hi(ʔ) in pause and in neutral environments.
-hi(ʔ) in pause and in neutral environments.
-hi(ʔ) in pause and in neutral environments.
-hi(ʔ) in pause and in neutral environments.
-hi(ʔ) in pause and in neutral environments.
-ha only after -ā, e.g. warā-ha; and in ʕalē-ha
